job.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
job.description: About MeterMeter is developing next-generation volumetric imaging technology. We are building a machine that can see inside of anything and cloud-based software for processing the complex, volumetric data that the machine produces. Our technology will give engineers, designers, and eventually medical practitioners more confidence in their processes and lower the barrier to high quality imaging and inspection tools.Our team of engineers includes world-class researchers, industrial designers, PhDs, founders of successful startups, and zero egos. We are backed by some of the top venture capital funds and angel investors in Silicon Valley and beyond. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, MA and has an office in San Francisco, CA.About The RoleWork closely with Meter’s hardware team to develop cutting edge software systems. Systems-thinking and the ability to evaluate a problem from multiple perspectives is a must. We are developing customer-facing software grounded in an innovative technology stack. This role will involve understanding data flow through a complex hardware-software system, characterizing and optimizing performance of different parts of the system, rapidly prototyping potential solutions, and always keeping the customer in mind.If you are interested in joining a well funded growth stage company this is the perfect opportunity for you to become a part of the Meter team. This role can be located in either Meter’s San Francisco or Boston office. You may be required to travel occasionally between the two offices.The JobBuild a software product from the ground upWork with an interdisciplinary team on a complex hardware-software problemImplement state-of-the-art algorithms for 3D image/volume reconstructionInform the technical development of a fast moving software productRapidly iterate on prototypes and build production softwareYouHave designed and implemented software throughout its lifecycle, taking a product from napkin sketches through shipping and maintenanceHave a strong grounding in computer science fundamentals Are able to communicate complex technical problems to peers from different backgroundsAre comfortable prototyping and building high performance web apps with React/AngularHave worked with AWS services (S3, EC2, ECS), Azure, or GCP, familiar with Docker, KubernetesBonus points for Experience with computational imaging, image processing, and 3D graphics/data (voxels, meshes)Familiarity with scientific computing in Python/C++ Familiarity with GPU programming (CUDA) Experience working in manufacturing, industrial inspection, or medical imagingA portfolio of your past work you can shareLI-METERMeter offers both competitive cash and equity compensation. We have a generous vacation policy as well as paid parental leave, health, dental, vision, retirement and commuter benefits.In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination or harassment based on “protected categories,” Meter also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior from ever gaining a foothold in our company. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Meter.Reach out if you want to be a part of what we are building.San Francisco Applicants: Review the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance guidelines applicable in your area.
